SENT.plain: Coexistence of aortic disease is an uncommon finding in end-stage heart failure patients requiring left ventricular assist device (LVAD) placement
A 38-year-old man with non-ischemic dilated cardiomyopathy was admitted in stage D heart failure
Preoperative computed tomography demonstrated multiple saccular aneurysms of the ascending aorta and sinus of valsalva
We successfully performed complex aortic surgery and the implantation of a continuous-flow LVAD (HeartWare HVAD) (HeartWare International, Framingham, MA)
The patient is currently listed for heart transplantation
